title: Never give up.
body:
http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/71713822/200314395?tab=overview

yet another example of why you should keep your mind on the game.

If falling behind, instead of fighting with your team, try hold the game out till late game and set up a good team fight.

gg all, besides the rage for 30mins from 1 person in the team, it was a mighty comeback 

{{champion:42}}

replies.body: I had a friend and should I say "had" friend who would give up when he died once or sulk over chat and just troll ( became to much after like the 8 game in row so I had to say somehting and we parted ways ). I'm always like never give up and when you win those games you don't give up they are the best ;)

#neversurrender

Expanding on the holding out to late game. 
- Ward; defensively to avoid picks when they've broken inner ring or offensively to create picks if only outers have dropped.
- Objectives; try to make an educated decision about whether an objective can be safely fought or whether it is even worth fighting for.  Create situation where you can contest valuable dragons. 
- Lane Control; try to keep all 3 of your lanes pushed up. This makes pushing harder for your enemies and could result in pressure or tower damage.
- Rotations; when giving up an objective, always try and trade it for something. Try split pushing techniques. Anything to disrupt what works for the enemy. 
- Defend towers; try not to lose tower just because you've been out-rotated.
- Don't die; I know easier said than done, when your behind, but if you can stop the feeding you stop their momentum. You also stop them increasing the gold gap, and work towards lowering the percentage gold difference as the game continues.

i like the "expanding on the holiday out to late game" part :P
